@@ -219,15 +222,39 @@ public ImportDictionary getExportDictionary(Class> type) *

* Using a batch update will most probably yield substantial performance benefits with the downside, that the updated * entity cannot be returned by this method. + *

+ * Note that {@link #createNowOrUpdateInBatch(BaseEntity)} is most probably a better choice, as it makes the entity + * immediatelly visible to the database and all internal consistency checks and still provides optimal performance + * when updating many objects. * * @param entity the entity to update or create * @param the generic type of the entity + * @see #createNowOrUpdateInBatch(BaseEntity) + * @see ImportHandler#createOrUpdateInBatch(BaseEntity) */ @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") public > void createOrUpdateInBatch(E entity) { context.findHandler((Class) entity.getClass()).createOrUpdateInBatch(entity); } + /** + * Creates the entity immediatelly or updates the given entity in the underlying database using a batch update.
